meanings.definition: Not able to be brought back or recovered.
meanings.sent1: The sunken ship was irreclaimable from the depths of the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The lost toy was irreclaimable after being swept away by the strong current.
meanings.sent3: The melted ice cream became irreclaimable as it dripped onto the hot pavement.
meanings.sent4: Her trust in him was irreclaimable, shattered beyond repair.
meanings.sent5: The broken vase lay irreclaimable in pieces on the floor.

meanings.definition: Unable to be redeemed or saved.
meanings.sent1: The irreclaimable debt burdened him with no hope of repayment.
meanings.sent2: The irreclaimable painting was damaged beyond restoration.
meanings.sent3: The irreclaimable cookie crumbled into a million pieces when touched.
meanings.sent4: His reputation was irreclaimable after the scandalous revelation.
meanings.sent5: The irreclaimable land was deemed unsuitable for cultivation.

meanings.sent1: The irreclaimable troublemaker continued to cause chaos in the classroom.
meanings.sent2: The irreclaimable criminal showed no signs of remorse for his actions.
meanings.sent3: The irreclaimable puppy chewed up yet another pair of shoes.
meanings.sent4: Her irreclaimable stubbornness made compromise impossible.
meanings.sent5: The irreclaimable graffiti artist left his mark on every wall in town.
